title: The Graphical Nadaraya-Watson Estimator on Latent Position Models. (arXiv:2303.17229v1 [stat.ML])
abstract: Given a graph with a subset of labeled nodes, we are interested in the quality of the averaging estimator which for an unlabeled node predicts the average of the observations of its labeled neighbours. We rigorously study concentration properties, variance bounds and risk bounds in this context. While the estimator itself is very simple and the data generating process is too idealistic for practical applications, we believe that our small steps will contribute towards the theoretical understanding of more sophisticated methods such as Graph Neural Networks.
context:
Title: The Graphical Nadaraya-Watson Estimator on Latent Position Models. (arXiv:2303.17229v1 [stat.ML])
Abstract: Given a graph with a subset of labeled nodes, we are interested in the quality of the averaging estimator which for an unlabeled node predicts the average of the observations of its labeled neighbours. We rigorously study concentration properties, variance bounds and risk bounds in this context. While the estimator itself is very simple and the data generating process is too idealistic for practical applications, we believe that our small steps will contribute towards the theoretical understanding of more sophisticated methods such as Graph Neural Networks.
translated_title: 潜在位置模型上的图形Nadaraya-Watson估计器
translated_abstract: 鉴于有标记节点的图形，我们对估计器的质量感兴趣，该估计器针对未标记节点预测其标记邻居的观测值的平均值。我们在这个背景下严格研究了浓度属性、方差界和风险界。虽然估计器本身非常简单，数据生成过程对于实际应用过于理想，但我们相信我们的小步骤将有助于更复杂方法（如图形神经网络）的理论理解。
tldr: 研究了潜在位置模型上的图形Nadaraya-Watson估计器的性质，对于更复杂的方法有理论指导意义。
en_tdlr: Studied the properties of the graphical Nadaraya-Watson estimator on latent position models, providing theoretical guidance for more sophisticated methods.
